fields.name: Sea Changed
fields.desc: The aboleth thrall can breathe water and air, but must bathe in water for 1 hour for every 12 hours it spends dry or it begins to suffocate. It is magically charmed by the aboleth.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The aboleths spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: 3/day each: detect thoughts (range 120 ft, desc: ), project image (range 1 mile), phantasmal force

fields.name: Camouflage
fields.desc: The yeti has advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

fields.name: Fire Fear
fields.desc: When the yeti takes fire damage, it is rattled until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Storm Sight
fields.desc: The yetis vision is not obscured by weather conditions.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The naga can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Forbiddance
fields.desc: The nagas lair is under the forbiddance spell. Until it is dispelled, creatures in the lair can't teleport or use planar travel. Fiends and undead that are not the nagas allies take 27 (5d10) radiant damage when they enter or start their turn in the lair.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The naga has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

fields.name: Spellcasting
fields.desc:
The naga is an 11th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 16). The naga has the following cleric spells prepared
 which it can cast with only vocalized components:
 Cantrips (at will): mending
 thaumaturgy
 1st-level (4 slots): command
 cure wounds
 false life
 2nd-level (3 slots): calm emotions
 hold person
 locate object
 3rd-level (3 slots) clairvoyance
 create food and water
 4th-level (3 slots): divination
 freedom of movement
 5th-level (2 slots): flame strike
 geas
 scrying
 6th-level (1 slot): forbiddance

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The naga can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The naga has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

fields.name: Spellcasting
fields.desc:
The acolyte is a 2nd level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12
 +4 to hit with spell attacks). They have the following cleric spells prepared:
 Cantrips (at will): light
 sacred flame
 thaumaturgy
 1st-level (3 slots): bless
 cure wounds
 sanctuary

fields.name: Far Thoughts
fields.desc: The dragon is aware of any creature that uses a psionic ability or communicates telepathically within 100 miles of it. As an action, the dragon can psionically observe a creature, object, or location it is familiar with within 100 miles. While observing a subject in this way, the dragon can see, hear, and communicate telepathically, but it is blind and deaf in regard to its physical senses and does not require food or water. The dragon can psionically observe a subject indefinitely and can end this effect and return to its own senses as an action.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 19). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:calm emotions, charm person, mass suggestion, modify memory

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: When the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does, its scales dull briefly, and it can't use telepathy or psionic abilities until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Psionic Powers
fields.desc: The dragons psionic abilities are considered both magical and psionic.

fields.name: Ambusher
fields.desc: When submerged in water, the dragon has advantage on Stealth checks. If the dragon hits a creature that can't see it with its bite, it can deal piercing damage and grapple the target simultaneously.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each: animate dead, fog cloud, legend lore, pass without trace, speak with dead

fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:fog cloud, pass without trace, legend lore, speak with dead

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: When the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does, it sheds some of its scales, which turn to mud. If it has no more uses of this ability, its Armor Class is reduced to 17 until it finishes a long rest.

fields.name: Ruthless (1/Round)
fields.desc: After scoring a critical hit on its turn, the dragon can immediately make one claw attack.

fields.name: Desert Farer
fields.desc: The dragon ignores difficult terrain or obscurement caused by sand or gravel, even while flying. Additionally, it ignores the effects of extreme heat.

fields.name: Dune Splitter
fields.desc: The dragon can remain submerged in sand and gravel for up to 4 hours. It has advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in this way.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 18). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:blur, silent image, blight, hypnotic pattern

fields.desc: When the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does, some of its scales fall away and turn to sand. If it has no more uses of this ability, its Armor Class is reduced to 16 until it finishes a long rest.

fields.name: Scholar of the Ages
fields.desc: The brass dragon gains a d4 expertise die on Intelligence checks made to recall lore. If it fails such a roll, it can use a Legendary Resistance to treat the roll as a 20.

fields.name: Self-Sufficient
fields.desc: The brass dragon can subsist on only a quart of water and a pound of food per day.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 18). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:fog cloud, speak with animals,commune with nature, speak with plants

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: When the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does, some of its scales fall away and turn to sea foam. If it has no more uses of this ability, its Armor Class is reduced to 16 until it finishes a long rest.

fields.name: Oracle of the Coast
fields.desc: The dragon can accurately predict the weather up to 7 days in advance and is never considered surprised while conscious. Additionally, by submerging itself in a body of water and spending 1 minute in concentration, it can cast scrying, requiring no components. The scrying orb appears in a space in the same body of water.

fields.name: Flow Within the Mountain
fields.desc: The dragon has advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in mountainous regions. By spending 1 minute in concentration while touching a natural stone surface, the dragon can merge into it and emerge from any connected stone surface within a mile.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:hideous laughter, suggestion, mislead, polymorph

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: When the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does, some of its scales fall away and turn to stone. If it has no more uses of this ability, its Armor Class is reduced to 16 until it finishes a long rest.

fields.name: Earth Glide
fields.desc: The dragon can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone without disturbing it.

fields.name: Essence Link
fields.desc: The essence dragon is spiritually linked to a specific area or landmark. The dragon gains no benefit from a long rest when more than 1 mile away from its linked area. If the dragon dies, the area it is linked to loses its vital essence until it forms a new essence dragon, which can take centuries. When a creature first enters an area that has lost its vital essence in this way, they gain a level of fatigue and a level of strife. This fatigue and strife can be removed only by completing a long rest outside the area.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the dragon remains motionless within its linked area, it is indistinguishable from a natural rocky outcropping.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:locate animals or plants, spike growth, stone shape, wall of stone

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: When the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does, it becomes more like rock. Its movement is halved until the end of its next turn.

fields.desc: The dragon is aware of any creature that uses a psionic ability or communicates telepathically within 100 miles of it. As an action, the dragon can psionically observe a creature, object, or location it is familiar with within 100 miles. While observing a subject in this way, the dragon can see, hear, and communicate telepathically, but it is blind and deaf in regard to its physical senses and does not require food or water. The dragon can psionically observe a subject indefinitely and can end this effect and return to its own senses as an action.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 18). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:confusion, dominate person, hideous laughter, suggestion

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: When the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does, its eyes flash red as it goes into a fit of rage. Until the end of its next turn, it makes melee attacks against the creature that triggered the saving throw with advantage and with disadvantage against all other creatures.

fields.name: Psionic Powers
fields.desc: The dragons psionic abilities are considered both magical and psionic.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 21). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:bless, healing word,banishment, greater restoration

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: When the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does, some of its scales melt away, forming pools of molten gold. If it has no more uses of this ability, its Armor Class is reduced to 17 until it finishes a long rest.

fields.name: Valor
fields.desc: Creatures of the dragons choice within 30 feet gain a +2 bonus to saving throws and are immune to the charmed and frightened conditions.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:animal messenger, tongues, modify memory, scrying

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: When the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does, it sheds some of its scales, which turn into dry leaves and blow away. If it has no more uses of this ability, its Armor Class is reduced to 17 until it finishes a long rest.

fields.name: Woodland Stalker
fields.desc: When in a forested area, the dragon has advantage on Stealth checks. Additionally, when it speaks in such a place, it can project its voice such that it seems to come from all around, allowing it to remain hidden while speaking.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 19). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:command, hold person, glyph of warding, wall of fire

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: When the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does, it sheds some of its scales, which turn to sand. If it has no more uses of this ability, its Armor Class is reduced to 17 until it finishes a long rest.

fields.name: Searing Heat
fields.desc: A creature that touches the dragon or hits it with a melee attack for the first time on a turn takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

fields.name: Volcanic Tyrant
fields.desc: The dragon is immune to the effects of poisonous gases caused by volcanic environments. It also ignores difficult terrain caused by lava.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Flowing Grace
fields.desc: The dragon doesnt provoke opportunity attacks when it flies or swims out of an enemys reach.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:create or destroy water, fog cloud, control water, freedom of movement

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: When the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does, it loses coordination as white-crested waves run up and down its body. It loses its Flowing Grace and Shimmering Scales traits until the beginning of its next turn.

fields.name: Shimmering Scales
fields.desc: While in water, the dragon gains three-quarters cover from attacks made by creatures more than 30 feet away.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: When the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does, its eyes dull as it briefly loses its connection to the future. Until the end of its next turn, it can't use Foretell, Prognosticate, or Prophesy Doom, and it loses its Predictive Harmonics trait.

fields.name: Predictive Harmonics
fields.desc: The dragon is psionically aware of its own immediate future. The dragon cannot be surprised, and any time the dragon would make a roll with disadvantage, it makes that roll normally instead.

fields.name: Psionic Powers
fields.desc: The dragons psionic abilities are considered both magical and psionic.

If the dragon dies, the area it is linked to loses its vital essence until it forms a new essence dragon, which can take centuries. When a creature first enters an area that has lost its vital essence in this way, they gain a level of fatigue and a level of strife. This fatigue and strife can be removed only by completing a long rest outside the area.

fields.name: Evil
fields.desc: The dragon radiates an Evil aura.

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The dragon can move through other creatures and objects. It takes 11 (2d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 20). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:darkness, detect evil and good, bane, create undead

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: When the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does, it becomes more solid, losing its Incorporeal trait and its damage resistances, until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Cloud Strider
fields.desc: The dragon suffers no harmful effects from high altitudes. When flying at high altitude, the dragon can, after 1 minute of concentration, discorporate into clouds. In this form, it has advantage on Stealth checks, its fly speed increases to 300 feet, it is immune to all nonmagical damage, it has resistance to magical damage, and it can't take any actions except Hide. If it takes damage or descends more than 500 feet from where it transformed, it immediately returns to its corporeal form. It can revert to its true form as an action.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 19). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:charm person, faerie fire,awaken, geas

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: When the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does, some of its scales dissipate into clouds. If it has no more uses of this ability, its Armor Class is reduced to 17 until it finishes a long rest.

fields.name: Cold Mastery
fields.desc: The dragons movement and vision is not hindered by cold, icy surfaces, snow, wind, or storms. Additionally, the dragon can choose to burrow through snow and ice without leaving a trace.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:dominate beast, fire shield, animal friendship, sleet storm

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: When the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does, it sheds some of its scales, which turn to ice. If it has no more uses of this ability, its Armor Class is reduced to 16 until it finishes a long rest.

fields.name: Air Form
fields.desc: The elemental can enter and end its turn in other creatures spaces and pass through an opening as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: An elemental doesnt require air, sustenance, or sleep.

fields.name: Divine Grace
fields.desc: If the empyrean makes a saving throw against an effect that deals half damage on a success, it takes no damage on a success and half damage on a failure. Furthermore, while wearing medium armor, the empyrean adds its full Dexterity bonus to its Armor Class (already included).

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The empyreans innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 23). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: charm person, command, telekinesis, 3/day: flame strike, hold monster, lightning bolt, 1/day: commune, greater restoration, heroes feast, plane shift (self only, can't travel to or from the Material Plane)

fields.name: Alchemy Schooling
fields.desc: The alchemist gains their proficiency bonus and an expertise die (+1d6) on checks made with alchemists supplies.

fields.name: Crafting
fields.desc: So long as the alchemist has the required components and equipment, they are able to craft potions of up to legendary rarity and other magic items of up to very rare rarity.

fields.name: Potion Crafter
fields.desc: The alchemist has the following potions on hand:

fields.name: Potion of climbing
fields.desc: For 1 hour, the drinker gains a climb speed equal to its Speed and has advantage on Athletics checks made to climb

fields.name: Potion of greater healing (3)
fields.desc: Restores 14 (4d4 + 4) hit points

fields.name: Potion of superior healing
fields.desc: Restores 28 (8d4 + 8) hit points

fields.name: Potion of water breathing
fields.desc: For 1 hour, the drinker can breathe underwater

fields.name: Cursed Wounds
fields.desc: Each of the werewolfs claw and bite attacks deals an additional 7 (2d6) necrotic damage, and the targets hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

fields.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The werewolf has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing or smell.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The werewolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the werewolfs allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not incapacitated.

fields.name: Wolfsbane
fields.desc: Lycanthropes are repelled by the wolfsbane flower. A lycanthrope in hybrid or beast form is poisoned while within 10 feet of a living or dried wolfsbane flower that it can smell. If wolfsbane is applied to a weapon or ammunition, lycanthropes are damaged by the weapon as if it were silver. An application of wolfsbane lasts for 1 hour.

When a creature first enters an area that has lost its vital essence in this way, they gain a level of fatigue and a level of strife. As an action, the dragon can psionically observe a creature, object, or location it is familiar with within 100 miles. While observing a subject in this way, the dragon can see, hear, and communicate telepathically, but it is blind and deaf in regard to its physical senses and does not require food or water. The dragon can psionically observe a subject indefinitely and can end this effect and return to its own senses as an action.

If it takes damage or descends more than 500 feet from where it transformed, it immediately returns to its corporeal form. The dragon can revert to its true form as an action.

fields.desc: When the guardian starts its turn while bloodied , roll a d6. On a 6, the guardian goes berserk. While berserk, the guardian attacks the nearest creature it can see. If it cant reach a creature, it attacks an object. The guardian stays berserk until it is destroyed or restored to full hit points.

fields.name: Bloodied Haste
fields.desc: While the guardian is bloodied, its speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws , and it can use its slam as a bonus action.

fields.name: Constructed Nature
fields.desc: Guardians dont require air, sustenance, or sleep.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The guardian is immune to any effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The guardian has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: When motionless, the cloaker is indistinguishable from a black cloak or similar cloth or leather article.

fields.name: Light Sensitivity
fields.desc: The cloaker has disadvantage on attack rolls and Perception checks while in bright light.

fields.name: Clockwork Nature
fields.desc: A clockwork doesnt require air, nourishment, or rest, and is immune to disease.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While motionless, the sentinel is indistinguishable from normal armor.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The clockwork is immune to any effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Cloud Sight
fields.desc: Clouds and fog do not impair the giants vision.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting

fields.name: Cloud Sight
fields.desc: Clouds and fog do not impair the giants vision.

fields.name: Area Vulnerability
fields.desc: The mob takes double damage from any effect that targets an area.

fields.name: Mob
fields.desc: The mob is composed of 10 or more commoners. If it is subjected to a spell, attack, or other effect that affects only one target, it takes any damage but ignores other effects. It can share its space with Medium or smaller creatures or objects. The mob can move through any opening large enough for one Medium creature.

fields.name: Mob Dispersal
fields.desc: When the mob is reduced to 0 hit points, it turns into 5 (1d6 + 2) commoners with 2 hit points.

fields.name: Flow Within the Mountain
fields.desc: The dragon has advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in mountainous regions.

fields.name: Aquatic
fields.desc: The coralfish can only breathe underwater.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The unicorn has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

fields.name: Alchemy Schooling
fields.desc: The alchemist gains their proficiency bonus and an expertise die (+1d6) on checks made with alchemists supplies.

fields.name: Crafting
fields.desc: So long as the alchemist has the required components and equipment, they are able to craft potions of up to legendary rarity and other magic items of up to very rare rarity.

fields.name: Potion Crafter
fields.desc: The alchemist has the following potions on hand:

fields.name: Potion of Climbing
fields.desc: For 1 hour, the drinker gains a climb speed equal to its Speed and has advantage on Athletics checks made to climb.

fields.name: Potion of Greater Healing (3)
fields.desc: Restores 14 (4d4 + 4) hit points.

fields.name: Potion of Superior Healing
fields.desc: Restores 28 (8d4 + 8) hit points.

fields.name: Potion of Water Breathing
fields.desc: For 1 hour, the drinker can breathe underwater.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The couatls spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: detect evil and good, detect magic, 3/day each: create food and water, detect thoughts, lesser restoration, 1/day each: dream, greater restoration, scrying

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The hag can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Curse
fields.desc: A creature touched by the hags claws is magically cursed for 30 days. While under this curse, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls made against the hag.

fields.name: Evil

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting

fields.name: Curse
fields.desc: A creature that accepts a gift from the hag is magically cursed for 30 days. While it is cursed, the target automatically fails saving throws against the hags charm person, geas, and scrying spells, and the hag can cast control weather centered on the creature.

fields.name: Icy Travel
fields.desc: The hag is not hindered by cold weather, icy surfaces, snow, wind, or storms. Additionally, the hag and her allies leave no trace when walking on snow or ice.

fields.name: Fanatic

fields.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
fields.desc: The cutthroat deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when they hit with a weapon attack while they have advantage on the attack, or when the cutthroats target is within 5 feet of an ally of the cutthroat while the cutthroat doesnt have disadvantage on the attack.

fields.name: Panicked Rage

fields.name: Poor Depth Perception

fields.name: Panicked Rage

fields.name: Poor Depth Perception

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While motionless, the darkmantle is indistinguishable from rock.

fields.name: Ethereal and Material
fields.desc: The dead mans fingers lives simultaneously on the Ethereal and Material Planes. Its senses extend into both planes, and it can touch and be touched by creatures on both planes.

fields.name: Ethereal Shift
fields.desc: When a creature on the Material Plane touches the dead mans fingers or hits it with a melee attack, the creature is magically transported to the Ethereal Plane. The creature can see and hear into both the Ethereal and Material Plane but is unaffected by creatures and objects on the Material Plane. It can be seen as a ghostly form by creatures on the Material Plane. It can move in any direction, with each foot of movement up or down costing 2 feet of movement.

fields.name: Flammable
fields.desc: After taking fire damage, the dead mans fingers catches fire and takes ongoing 11 (2d10) fire damage if it isnt already suffering ongoing fire damage. It can spend an action or bonus action to extinguish this fire.

fields.name: If the creature is still on the Ethereal Plane when the dead mans fingers dies, the creature returns
fields.desc: If this would cause a creature to appear in a space occupied by a solid object or creature, it is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and takes 10 (3d6) force damage.

fields.name: Two Heads
fields.desc: The death dog has advantage on Perception checks and on saving throws made to resist being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious, and it can't be flanked.

fields.name: Deep Dwarf Magic
fields.desc: The deep dwarf can innately cast enlarge/reduce (self only, enlarge only) and invisibility (self only) once per long rest without using material components, using Intelligence for their spellcasting ability.

fields.name: Deep Dwarf Resistance
fields.desc: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against illusions and to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

fields.name: Camouflage
fields.desc: The scout has advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

fields.name: Deep Gnome Magic
fields.desc: The deep gnome can innately cast blindness/deafness (blindness only), disguise self, and nondetection once per long rest without using material components, using Intelligence for their spellcasting ability.

fields.name: Deep Gnome Resistance
fields.desc: The scout has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

fields.name: Keen Hearing and Sight

fields.name: Keen Smell

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
fields.desc: If the demilich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, one of the five tiny warding gems set on its forehead or teeth shatters.

fields.desc: A demilich doesnt require air, sustenance, or sleep.

fields.name: Draconic Smite

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: Gargoyles dont require air, sustenance, or sleep.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While motionless, the gargoyle is indistinguishable from a normal statue.

fields.name: Legion
fields.desc: The dread knights sword is a +3 greatsword that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls when it attacks with its cursed greatsword. A humanoid killed by damage from this sword rises the next dusk as a zombie. While attuned to the sword, the dread knight can use a bonus action to command zombies created in this way.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: A dread knight doesnt require air, sustenance, or sleep.

fields.name: Unholy Aura
fields.desc: The dread knight and allies within 30 feet have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magic effects and against features that turn undead. Other creatures of the dread knights choice within 30 feet have disadvantage on saving throws against spells and other magic effects.

Other creatures of the dread knights choice within 30 feet have disadvantage on saving throws against spells and other magic effects.

fields.name: 1-4: Arm
fields.desc: If the troll has an arm, it loses an arm. It loses one of its claw attacks, and the severed arm can make a claw attack.

fields.name: 5-6: Head
fields.desc: If the troll has a head, it loses its head. It loses its bite attack, and the severed head can make a bite attack.

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The troll has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesnt function on its next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesnt regenerate.

fields.name: Severed Limbs
fields.desc: If the troll is dealt a critical hit with a slashing weapon, one of its extremities is severed. The extremity has AC 15, 10 hit points, a Speed of 10, and the trolls Regeneration trait. The troll controls the severed extremity and perceives through it with the appropriate senses (for instance, it sees through the eyes of its severed head). As a bonus action, the troll can reattach the extremity. While the troll is missing the extremity, its maximum hit points are reduced by 10. Roll d6 to determine the severed extremity:

fields.name: Chaotic Evil
fields.desc: The dretch radiates a Chaotic and Evil aura.

fields.name: Energy-Sucking Aura
fields.desc: A non-demon creature that takes an action or bonus action while within 10 feet of a dretch can't take another action, bonus action, or reaction until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The drider can use its climb speed even on difficult surfaces and upside down on ceilings.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the drider has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Perception checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Web Walker
fields.desc: The drider ignores movement restrictions imposed by webs.

fields.name: Drop
fields.desc: The drop bear takes no damage from falling 40 feet or fewer and deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits with an attack after falling at least 20 feet. A creature that takes this extra damage is knocked prone.

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The bear has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Stealthy
fields.desc: The drop bear has advantage on Stealth checks in forested areas.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

fields.name: Speak with Nature
fields.desc: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants.

fields.name: Tree Stride
fields.desc: Once per turn, the dryad can use 10 feet of movement to enter a living tree and emerge from another living tree within 60 feet. Both trees must be at least Large.

fields.name: Death Burst
fields.desc: When the mephit dies, it explodes into dust. Each creature within 5 feet makes a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is blinded until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: A mephit doesnt require air, sustenance, or sleep.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While motionless, the mephit is indistinguishable from a pile of dirt.

fields.name: Earth Glide
fields.desc: The dragon can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone without disturbing it.

fields.name: Essence Link
fields.desc: The essence dragon is spiritually linked to a specific area or landmark. The dragon gains no benefit from a long rest when more than 1 mile away from its linked area. If the dragon dies, the area it is linked to loses its vital essence until it forms a new essence dragon, which can take centuries. When a creature first enters an area that has lost its vital essence in this way, they gain a level of fatigue and a level of strife. This fatigue and strife can be removed only by completing a long rest outside the area.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the dragon remains motionless within its linked area, it is indistinguishable from a natural rocky outcropping.

fields.name: Earth Glide

fields.name: Amorphous
fields.desc: The pudding can pass through an opening as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Corrosive Body
fields.desc: A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet takes 9 (2d8) acid damage. A nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the black pudding corrodes after dealing damage, taking a permanent -1 penalty to damage rolls per hit. If this penalty reaches -5, the weapon is destroyed. Wooden or metal nonmagical ammunition is destroyed after dealing damage. Any other metal or organic object that touches it takes 9 (2d8) acid damage.

fields.name: Ooze Nature
fields.desc: An ooze doesnt require air or sleep.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The pudding can use its climb speed even on difficult surfaces and upside down on ceilings.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the pudding has disadvantage on attack rolls.

fields.name: Blood Frenzy
fields.desc: While bloodied, the vampire can take 3 legendary actions instead of 1.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: When the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, it visibly grows older. Its original appearance is restored when it finishes a long rest.

fields.name: Misty Recovery
fields.desc: When the vampire drops to 0 hit points, instead of falling unconscious, it turns into mist as if it had used the Mist Form legendary action. It can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to vampire form and is paralyzed for 1 hour, at which time it regains 1 hit point. While paralyzed in this way, it can be destroyed by fire damage, radiant damage, damage from a magical weapon, or a wooden stake driven through the heart, but it is otherwise immune to damage.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and hasnt taken radiant damage since its last turn.

fields.name: Resting Place
fields.desc: Every vampires lair contains a resting place, usually a coffin or sarcophagus, where the vampire must rest for at least an hour each day to recuperate its powers. This resting place is sprinkled with soil from its mortal homeland. If this soil is scattered or is subjected to a bless, hallow, or similar spell, the vampire is destroyed when reduced to 0 hit points.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The vampire can climb even on difficult surfaces and upside down on ceilings.

fields.name: Vampire Weaknesses
fields.desc: Vampires most common weaknesses are sunlight and running water. When the vampire ends its turn in contact with one of its weaknesses (such as being bathed in sunlight or running water), it takes 20 radiant damage. While in contact with its weakness, it can't use its Regeneration trait or its Mist Form or Shapechange actions.

fields.name: Far Thoughts
fields.desc: The dragon is aware of any creature that uses a psionic ability or communicates telepathically within 100 miles of it. As an action, the dragon can psionically observe a creature, object, or location it is familiar with within 100 miles. While observing a subject in this way, the dragon can see, hear, and communicate telepathically, but it is blind and deaf in regard to its physical senses and does not require food or water. The dragon can psionically observe a subject indefinitely and can end this effect and return to its own senses as an action.

fields.name: Divine Grace
fields.desc: If the empyrean makes a saving throw against an effect that deals half damage on a success, it takes no damage on a success and half damage on a failure. Furthermore, while wearing medium armor, the empyrean adds its full Dexterity bonus to its Armor Class (already included).

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The empyreans innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 23). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: charm person, command, telekinesis, 3/day: flame strike, hold monster, lightning bolt, 1/day: commune, greater restoration, heroes feast, plane shift (self only, can't travel to or from the Material Plane)

fields.name: Lawful Evil

fields.name: Magic Resistance

fields.name: Web Sense

fields.name: Web Walker
fields.desc: The ettercap ignores movement restrictions imposed by webs.

fields.name: Reactive Heads
fields.desc: The ettin can take two reactions each round, but not more than one per turn.

fields.name: Two Heads
fields.desc: While both heads are awake, the ettin has advantage on Perception checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious, and it can't be flanked.

fields.name: Wakeful
fields.desc: When one of the ettins heads is asleep, the other is awake.

The dragon gains additional spells as it ages. 5 years old, at will: dancing lights, mage hand, minor illusion, 10 years old, 1/day: suggestion, 30 years old, 1/day: major image, 50 years old, 1/day: hallucinatory terrain

fields.desc: If the troll is dealt a critical hit with a slashing weapon, one of its extremities is severed. The extremity has AC 15, 10 hit points, a Speed of 10, and the trolls Regeneration trait. The troll controls the severed extremity and perceives through it with the appropriate senses (for instance, it sees through the eyes of its severed head). As a bonus action, the troll can reattach the extremity. While the troll is missing the extremity, its maximum hit points are reduced by 10. Roll d6 to determine the severed extremity:

fields.name: Faerie Form

Additionally, it has disadvantage on Strength checks and advantage on Dexterity checks. While Large, the noble has advantage on Strength checks. Its statistics are otherwise unchanged.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting

fields.name: Aligned

fields.name: Berserk

If it can't reach a creature, it attacks an object. The guardian stays berserk until it is destroyed or restored to full hit points.

fields.desc: Guardians dont require air, sustenance, or sleep.

fields.name: Fire Fear
fields.desc: When the guardian takes fire damage, it is rattled until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: If a berserk guardian can see and hear its creator, the creator can use an action to try to calm it
fields.desc: On a success, the guardian is no longer berserk.

The mage is a 9th level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14

fields.name: Essence Link
fields.desc: The essence dragon is spiritually linked to a specific area or landmark. The dragon gains no benefit from a long rest when more than 1 mile away from its linked area. If the dragon dies, the area it is linked to loses its vital essence until it forms a new essence dragon, which can take centuries. When a creature first enters an area that has lost its vital essence in this way, they gain a level of fatigue and a level of strife. This fatigue and strife can be removed only by completing a long rest outside the area.

fields.name: Flowing Grace
fields.desc: The dragon doesnt provoke opportunity attacks when it flies or swims out of an enemys reach.

fields.name: Keen Sight

fields.name: False Appearance

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The roper can climb even on difficult surfaces and upside down on ceilings.

fields.name: Tendrils
fields.desc: The roper has eight tendrils. Each tendril has AC 20, 15 hit points, vulnerability to slashing damage, and immunity to psychic damage. A creature can also break a tendril by taking an action to make a DC 15 Strength check. A tendril takes no damage from sources other than attacks. The roper grows back any destroyed tendrils after a long rest.

fields.desc: A nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the rust monster corrodes after dealing damage, taking a permanent -1 penalty to damage rolls per hit. If this penalty reaches -5, the weapon is destroyed. Metal nonmagical ammunition is destroyed after dealing damage.

A creature can take this damage only once per turn. If the salamander has taken cold damage since the end of its last turn, this trait doesnt function.

A creature can take this damage only once per turn. If the salamander has taken cold damage since its last turn, this trait doesnt function.

fields.name: Far Thoughts
fields.desc: The dragon is aware of any creature that uses a psionic ability or communicates telepathically within 100 miles of it. As an action, the dragon can psionically observe a creature, object, or location it is familiar with within 100 miles. While observing a subject in this way, the dragon can see, hear, and communicate telepathically, but it is blind and deaf in regard to its physical senses and does not require food or water. The dragon can psionically observe a subject indefinitely and can end this effect and return to its own senses as an action.

fields.name: Magic Resistance

fields.name: Flammable
fields.desc: After taking fire damage, the scarecrow catches fire and takes 5 (1d10) ongoing fire damage if it isnt already suffering ongoing fire damage. A creature can spend an action to extinguish this fire.

fields.name: Spell-created
fields.desc: The DC for dispel magic to disable this creature is 19. A disabled scarecrow is inanimate. After one hour, it becomes animate again unless its body has been destroyed.

This trait also doesnt function if the troll hasnt been immersed in water since the start of its last turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesnt regenerate.

fields.name: Severed Limbs
fields.desc: If the troll is dealt a critical hit with a slashing weapon, one of its extremities is severed. The extremity has AC 15, 10 hit points, a Speed of 10, and the trolls Regeneration trait. The troll controls the severed extremity and perceives through it with the appropriate senses (for instance, it sees through the eyes of its severed head). As a bonus action, the troll can reattach the extremity. While the troll is missing the extremity, its maximum hit points are reduced by 10. Roll d6 to determine the severed extremity:

fields.desc: If the treant takes fire damage, it catches fire, taking 10 (3d6) ongoing fire damage, unless it is already on fire. It can use an action to extinguish itself, ending the ongoing damage.

fields.name: Forest Speaker
fields.desc: The treant can communicate with beasts and plants.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The treant deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Spellcasting
fields.desc:
The priest is a 5th level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13
 +5 to hit with spell attacks). They have the following cleric spells prepared:
 Cantrips (at will): sacred flame
 thaumaturgy
 minor illusion
 1st-level (4 slots): ceremony
 detect evil and good
 healing word
 disguise self
 2nd-level (3 slots): lesser restoration
 invisibility
 3rd-level (2 slots): spirit guardians
 major image

fields.name: Stench
fields.desc: A non-troglodyte that starts its turn within 5 feet of the troglodyte makes a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to a troglodytes Stench for 24 hours.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the troglodyte has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Perception checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: 1-4: Arm
fields.desc: If the troll has an arm, it loses an arm. It loses one of its claw attacks, and the severed arm can make a claw attack.

fields.name: 5-6: Head
fields.desc: If the troll has a head, it loses its head. It loses its bite attack, and the severed head can make a bite attack.

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The troll has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesnt function on its next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesnt regenerate.

fields.name: Severed Limbs
fields.desc: If the troll is dealt a critical hit with a slashing weapon, one of its extremities is severed. The extremity has AC 15, 10 hit points, a Speed of 10, and the trolls Regeneration trait. The troll controls the severed extremity and perceives through it with the appropriate senses (for instance, it sees through the eyes of its severed head). As a bonus action, the troll can reattach the extremity. While the troll is missing the extremity, its maximum hit points are reduced by 10. Roll d6 to determine the severed extremity:

fields.name: Good
fields.desc: The unicorn radiates a Good aura.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The unicorns innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: animal messenger, detect evil and good, druidcraft, pass without trace, scrying (locations within its domain only), 1/day: calm emotions, dispel evil and good, teleport (between locations within its domain only)

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
fields.desc: If the ur-otyugh fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, it becomes more sluggish. Each time the ur-otyugh uses Legendary Resistance, its Speed and swim speed decrease by 10 and it loses one of its legendary actions on each of its turns.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: When the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, it visibly grows older. Its original appearance is restored when it finishes a long rest.

fields.name: Misty Recovery
fields.desc: When the vampire drops to 0 hit points, instead of falling unconscious, it turns into mist as if it had used the Mist Form legendary action. It can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to vampire form and is paralyzed for 1 hour, at which time it regains 1 hit point. While paralyzed in this way, it can be destroyed by fire damage, radiant damage, damage from a magical weapon, or a wooden stake driven through the heart, but it is otherwise immune to damage.

fields.name: Misty Stealth
fields.desc: While in Mist Form in dim light or darkness, the vampire is invisible.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and hasnt taken radiant damage since its last turn.

fields.name: Resting Place
fields.desc: Every vampires lair contains a resting place, usually a coffin or sarcophagus, where the vampire must rest for at least an hour each day to recuperate its powers. This resting place is sprinkled with soil from its mortal homeland. If this soil is scattered or is subjected to a bless, hallow, or similar spell, the vampire is destroyed when reduced to 0 hit points.

fields.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
fields.desc: The vampire deals an extra 10 (3d6) damage when it hits with a weapon attack while it has advantage on the attack, or when its target is within 5 feet of an ally of the vampire while the vampire doesnt have disadvantage on the attack.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The vampire can climb even on difficult surfaces and upside down on ceilings.

fields.name: Vampire Weaknesses
fields.desc: Vampires most common weaknesses are sunlight and running water. When the vampire ends its turn in contact with one of its weaknesses (such as being bathed in sunlight or running water), it takes 20 radiant damage. While in contact with its weakness, it can't use its Regeneration trait or its Mist Form or Shapechange actions.

fields.name: Ethereal Sight
fields.desc: The ghost can see into both the Material and Ethereal Plane.

fields.name: Graveborn Strength
fields.desc: When not in sunlight, creatures make their saving throws against the ghosts Horrifying Visage and Possession abilities with disadvantage.

fields.name: Incorporeal
fields.desc: The ghost can move through creatures and objects. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: A ghost doesnt require air, sustenance, or sleep.

fields.name: Unquiet Spirit
fields.desc: If defeated in combat, the ghost returns in 24 hours. It can be put to rest permanently only by finding and casting remove curse on its remains or by resolving the unfinished business that keeps it from journeying to the afterlife.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While motionless, the violet fungus is indistinguishable from a normal fungus.

fields.name: Chaotic Evil
fields.desc: The vrock radiates a Chaotic and Evil aura.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The vrock has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

fields.name: Keen Sight and Smell
fields.desc: The vulture has advantage on Perception checks that rely on sight and smell.

fields.name: Bludgeoning Weakness
fields.desc: When the statue takes more than 10 bludgeoning damage from one attack, it falls prone.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While motionless, the statue is indistinguishable from a normal statue.

fields.name: Spell-created
fields.desc: The DC for dispel magic to destroy this creature is 19.

fields.name: Luring Scent
fields.desc: When a beast, humanoid or fey creature begins its turn within 30 feet, the creature makes a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it moves as close as it can to the wallflower and ends its turn. Creatures immune to being charmed are immune to this effect. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Luring Scent of all wallflowers for 24 hours.

fields.name: Aggressive Charge
fields.desc: The eye moves up to their Speed towards an enemy they can see or hear.

 detect evil and good

bless

arcane eye

fields.name: Warhordling Orc Eye Spellcasting
fields.desc: The eye has advantage on attack rolls made against targets they can see with arcane eye.

fields.name: Death Howl
fields.desc: When reduced to 0 hit points, the banshee uses Baleful Wail.

fields.name: Detect Life
fields.desc: The banshee magically senses the general direction of living creatures up to 5 miles away.

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The banshee can move through creatures and objects. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: A banshee doesnt require air, sustenance, or sleep.

fields.name: Unquiet Spirit
fields.desc: If defeated in combat, the banshee returns on the anniversary of its death. It can be permanently put to rest only by finding and casting remove curse on its grave or by righting whatever wrong was done to it.

fields.name: Area Vulnerability
fields.desc: The band takes double damage from any effect that targets an area.

fields.name: Band
fields.desc: The band is composed of 5 or more warriors. If it is subjected to a spell, attack, or other effect that affects only one target, it takes any damage but ignores other effects. It can share its space with Medium or smaller creatures or objects. The band can move through any opening large enough for one Medium creature without squeezing.

fields.name: Band Dispersal
fields.desc: When the band is reduced to 0 hit points, it turns into 2 (1d4) warriors with 5 hit points each.

fields.name: Conductive
fields.desc: If the elemental takes lightning damage, each creature sharing its space takes the same amount of lightning damage.

fields.name: Fluid Form
fields.desc: The elemental can enter and end its turn in other creatures spaces and move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Freeze
fields.desc: If the elemental takes cold damage, its speed is reduced by 15 feet until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The weasel has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing and smell.

fields.name: Keen Smell
fields.desc: The werebear has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Wolfsbane
fields.desc: Lycanthropes are repelled by the wolfsbane flower. A lycanthrope in hybrid or beast form is poisoned while within 10 feet of a living or dried wolfsbane flower that it can smell. If wolfsbane is applied to a weapon or ammunition, lycanthropes are damaged by the weapon as if it were silver. An application of wolfsbane lasts for 1 hour.

fields.name: Relentless (1/Day)
fields.desc: If the wereboar takes 14 or less damage that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is instead reduced to 1 hit point.

fields.desc: The wererat has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

fields.name: Pack Tactics

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The werewolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the werewolfs allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not incapacitated.

fields.name: Cold Mastery
fields.desc: The dragons movement and vision is not hindered by cold, icy surfaces, snow, wind, or storms. Additionally, the dragon can choose to burrow through snow and ice without leaving a trace.

fields.name: Cold Aura
fields.desc: A creature that starts its turn grappled by the wight, touches it, or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet takes 3 (1d6) cold damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn. If the wight has been subjected to fire damage since its last turn, this trait doesnt function.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Perception checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: A wight doesnt require air, sustenance, or sleep.

fields.name: Conductive
fields.desc: Each time a creature touches the will-o-wisp or hits it with a metal melee weapon for the first time on a turn, the creature takes 7 (2d6) lightning damage. This trait doesnt function while the will-o-wisps glow is extinguished.

fields.name: Insubstantial
fields.desc: The will-o-wisp can't pick up or move objects or creatures. It can move through creatures and objects. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Treasure Sense
fields.desc: The will-o-wisp knows the location of coins, gems, and other nonmagical wealth within 500 feet.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: A will-o-wisp doesnt require air, sustenance, or sleep.

fields.name: Curse
fields.desc: A creature that accepts a gift from the hag is magically cursed for 30 days. While it is cursed, the target automatically fails saving throws against the hags charm person, geas, and scrying spells, and the hag can cast control weather centered on the creature.

fields.name: Icy Travel
fields.desc: The hag is not hindered by cold weather, icy surfaces, snow, wind, or storms. Additionally, the hag and her allies leave no trace when walking on snow or ice.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The hags innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: charm person, dancing lights, invisibility, minor illusion, passwall (ice only), 1/day: control weather (extreme cold), geas, scrying

fields.name: Trained Accuracy

fields.desc: The worg has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing and smell.

fields.name: Aura of Fear
fields.desc: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of a wraith lord makes a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it is frightened until the start of its next turn. If a creatures saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it is immune to any wraith or wraith lords Aura of Fear for 24 hours.

fields.name: Evil
fields.desc: The wraith lord radiates an Evil aura.

fields.name: Incorporeal
fields.desc: The wraith lord can move through creatures and objects. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. If it takes radiant damage, it loses this trait until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Light Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight or bright light cast by a fire, the wraith lord has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Perception checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: A wraith doesnt require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Aura of Fear

fields.name: Imperfect Flight

fields.desc: The xorn has advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

fields.name: Earth Glide
fields.desc: The xorn can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone without disturbing it.

fields.name: Treasure Sense
fields.desc: The xorn can locate by smell coins and gems within 500 feet.

fields.name: Camouflage
fields.desc: The yeti has advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

fields.name: Fire Fear
fields.desc: When the yeti takes fire damage, it is rattled until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Storm Sight
fields.desc: The yetis vision is not obscured by weather conditions.

fields.name: Explosive Death
fields.desc: When a yobbo is reduced to 0 hitpoints, its body explodes and releases a random1st-level spell. This spell targets the creature nearestto the yobbos corpse.

fields.name: Magic Eater
fields.desc: Yobbos figure all magic works the sameway that magic potions do. As such, they devour spellcomponents, spell scrolls, and magical trinketsalikewhen they are made aware of them. Yobbos instinctivelyknow which creatures have magic items onthem. When they successfully grab a creature, theyuse their next action to take that creatures nearestmagic item and then stuff it down their throats. Ifit is a weapon, it deals damage to them as if theydbeen hit by that weapon. If its a piece of armor, theirmouths stretch to fit around it. They are now imbuedwith the powers of the devoured magic item.

fields.name: Far Thoughts
fields.desc: The dragon is aware of any creature that uses a psionic ability or communicates telepathically within 100 miles of it. As an action, the dragon can psionically observe a creature, object, or location it is familiar with within 100 miles. While observing a subject in this way, the dragon can see, hear, and communicate telepathically, but it is blind and deaf in regard to its physical senses and does not require food or water. The dragon can psionically observe a subject indefinitely and can end this effect and return to its own senses as an action.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 19). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:calm emotions, charm person

fields.name: Ambusher
fields.desc: When submerged in water, the dragon has advantage on Stealth checks. If the dragon hits a creature that can't see it with its bite, it can deal piercing damage and grapple the target simultaneously.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:fog cloud, pass without trace

fields.name: Ruthless (1/Round)
fields.desc: After scoring a critical hit on its turn, the dragon can immediately make one claw attack.

fields.name: Desert Farer
fields.desc: The dragon ignores difficult terrain or obscurement caused by sand or gravel, even while flying. Additionally, it ignores the effects of extreme heat.

fields.name: Dune Splitter
fields.desc: The dragon can remain submerged in sand and gravel for up to 4 hours. It has advantage on Stealth checks to hide in this way.

fields.name: Oracle of the Coast
fields.desc: The dragon can accurately predict the weather up to 7 days in advance and is never considered surprised while conscious.

fields.name: Flow Within the Mountain

fields.name: Earth Glide
fields.desc: The dragon can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone without disturbing it.

fields.name: Essence Link
fields.desc: The essence dragon is spiritually linked to a specific area or landmark. The dragon gains no benefit from a long rest when more than 1 mile away from its linked area. If the dragon dies, the area it is linked to loses its vital essence until it forms a new essence dragon, which can take centuries. When a creature first enters an area that has lost its vital essence in this way, they gain a level of fatigue and a level of strife. This fatigue and strife can be removed only by completing a long rest outside the area.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the dragon remains motionless within its linked area, it is indistinguishable from a natural rocky outcropping.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:locate animals or plants, spike growth

fields.desc: The dragon is immune to the effects of poisonous gases caused by volcanic environments. It also ignores difficult terrain caused by lava.

fields.name: Essence Link
fields.desc: The essence dragon is spiritually linked to a specific area or landmark. The dragon gains no benefit from a long rest when more than 1 mile away from its linked area. If the dragon dies, the area it is linked to loses its vital essence until it forms a new essence dragon, which can take centuries. When a creature first enters an area that has lost its vital essence in this way, they gain a level of fatigue and a level of strife. This fatigue and strife can be removed only by completing a long rest outside the area.

fields.name: Flowing Grace
fields.desc: The dragon doesnt provoke opportunity attacks when it flies or swims out of an enemys reach.
